abstract: Even though Amazon is now collecting sales tax on shipments to New York State, at least one analyst suggests that its sales to the state will hardly fall. Online shoppers value convenience more than lower prices, some research shows.
snippet: Even though Amazon is now collecting sales tax on shipments to New York State, at least one analyst suggests that its sales to the state will hardly fall. Online shoppers value convenience more than lower prices, some research shows.
lead_paragraph: The comments to our posts about a rule that forced Amazon.com and some other large online stores to collect sales tax on shipments to New York State residents reflect the interest Internet shoppers have in tax policies. Many agreed with a respondent named Michael who said, “And just like that, I stop using Amazon. Pity.”

headline.main: Will Amazon Lose Sales Because It Collects New York Taxes?
